voicesplitting.voice.hmm

Class State

  • java.lang.Object
    • voicesplitting.voice.hmm.State
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<State>

    public class State
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<State>
    A State is used by the HmmVoiceSplitter and contains a List of the SingleNoteVoices which are currently present in the HMM as well as its cumulative probability so far.
    Author:
    Andrew McLeod - 7 April, 2015

    • Method Detail

      • getAllCandidateNewStates

        public java.util.List<State> getAllCandidateNewStates(java.util.List<MidiNote> incoming)
        Get all of the candidate states based on transitions from this State given the incoming notes.
        Parameters:
        incoming - A List of incoming notes.
        Returns:
        A List of possible States which we could transition into.

      • getAllCandidateNewStatesRecursive

        private java.util.List<State> getAllCandidateNewStatesRecursive(java.util.List<MidiNote> incoming,
                                                      java.util.List<SingleNoteVoice> newVoices,
                                                      double logProbSum,
                                                      int index)
        This method does the work for getAllCandidateNewStates(List) recursively.
        Parameters:
        incoming - A List of incoming notes.
        newVoices - A List of the Voices in this State as it is now. For each recursive call, this should be a deep copy since the Voices that lie within will be changed.
        logProbSum - The sum of the current log probability of this State, including any transitions already made recursively.
        index - The index of the note which we are tasked with transitioning on.
        Returns:
        A List of all States which could be transitioned into given the parameters.

      • getOpenVoiceIndeces

        private java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> getOpenVoiceIndeces(long onsetTime,
                                                                    java.util.List<MidiNote> incoming,
                                                                    java.util.List<SingleNoteVoice> newVoices)
        Get a List of the indeces at which open voices are in the given List of Voices.
        Parameters:
        onsetTime - The time we want to check for open Voices.
        incoming - A List of the MidiNotes which occur at the given onset time.
        newVoices - A List of the Voices we want to check.
        Returns:
        A List of the open voices in newVoices for each incoming note. return.get(i).get(j) will return the index of the (j+1)th (since it is 0-indexed) open Voice in newVoices for the ith note from incoming.

      • getDeepCopy

        private java.util.List<SingleNoteVoice> getDeepCopy(java.util.List<SingleNoteVoice> newVoices)
        Create a deep copy of the given List of Voices.
        Parameters:
        newVoices - The List we want to get a deep copy of.
        Returns:
        A new List, a deep copy of the given one.

      • reverseTransition

        private void reverseTransition(int transition,
                     java.util.List<SingleNoteVoice> newVoices)
        Reverse the given transition.
        Parameters:
        transition - The transition we want to reverse.
        newVoices - The Voices List where we want to reverse the transition.

      • doTransition

        private void doTransition(MidiNote note,
                int transition,
                java.util.List<SingleNoteVoice> newVoices)
        Perform the given transition WITHOUT calculating probability.
        Parameters:
        note - The note we want to add to a Voice.
        transition - The value of the transition we want to perform on the given note. A negative value tells us to add the note to a new Voice placed at index (-transition - 1). Any non-negative value means to add the note into the Voice at that index in newVoices.
        newVoices - A List of the Voices available to have notes added to them.

      • getTransitionProb

        private double getTransitionProb(MidiNote note,
                       int transition,
                       java.util.List<SingleNoteVoice> newVoices)
        Get the probability of the given transition occurring.
        Parameters:
        note - The note we want to add to a Voice.
        transition - The value of the transition we want to perform on the given note. A negative value tells us to add the note to a new Voice placed at index (-transition - 1). Any non-negative value means to add the note into the Voice at that index in newVoices.
        newVoices - A List of the Voices available to have notes added to them.
        Returns:
        The probability of the given transition.

      • getVoices

        public java.util.List<SingleNoteVoice> getVoices()
        Get a list of the Voices we've found in this State.
        Returns:
        voices

        public double getLogProb()
        Get the log probability of appearing in this State.
        Returns:

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(State o)
        The default State Comparator. States are naturally ordered by decreasing logProb.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<State>
        Parameters:
        o - The other State we are comparing against. If null, we return -1.
        Returns:
        The int representing whether the ordering of this State with the given one.
